Reviews: perfect location for exploring downtown manhattan. the 9/11 memorial is just two blocks away. the building also houses a starbucks and a burger restaurant. the staten island ferry is also just a 10-minute walk away.

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: super comfy beds and kept wonderfully clean. walked to all attractions and close to express subway.

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: wonderful service and great room service!!!

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: they have a hidden destination fee which i didnt like! other than that, there wasnt much difference in the rooms compared to a simple cheaper motels.

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: hotel was dirty - my son got bites or a rash on him from being in his crib and the customer service was some of the worst other than the front desk manager. we won’t stay at marriott again.

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: they tacked on a surprise bike fee for the 5 borough bike tour even though we had folding bikes. really scummy. restaurant is mediocre.

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews:
decent hotel in downtown manhattan with good rooms but with an exorbitant fee ($52/night).

the check-in was a disaster, the person who attended us did not understand absolutely anything (between the mask and the fact that he spoke super fast), to give you an idea, we did not even know the room number. gentlemen of the hotel, we tourists adapt and try to understand their language but you working in the tourist sector must keep in mind that you are dealing with people who do not speak your same language and even adapting to ours is part of your profession.

the wifi in our room did not work, its captive portal did not work and we could not use it.

the checkout was perfect and fast.

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews:
the hotel is a bit old but well maintained and clean.
but the highlight is the location. wall street, the metro, even the ferry docks are within easy walking distance

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: terrible service , rest was good

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: rooms are very dark. comfortable bed.

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: recently stayed here over spring break with my friends. after a long travel day the lady who checked us in was very kind and accommodating. the hotel room was clean and quiet. overall we enjoyed our stay and the lady who checked us in made sure we had a great stay! will definitely be returning in the future.

title: W New York - Times Square

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: nice hotel

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: the hotel was clean but we think there can be a little bit of renovated for this hotel like new tables for the breakfast area new floors and fixing up the walls. another thing we can renovated the reception area.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: a great hotel in the heart of new york that allows you to have a great experience and explore this iconic place in the city.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: great rooms! nice and close to times square!

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: stayed for our anniversary weekend which was also memorial day weekend. nuck, the valet was great in addition to the front desk workers. location is amazing, but room is comparable to a motel 6. we accepted the accessibility room after being told that the only difference is the hand rails in the bathroom. once we saw the room, i immediately called to request a room change which they couldn’t accommodate… although we had just checked in. i asked if we could move the next day which was sunday, never received a call or message stating it was ready, the ac in the room was not flowing properly at all. the shower pressure was very weak and overall, the room did not look as nice as the website’s pictures. compared to other marriott sites, this room felt small and cramped. bathroom did not have any counter space. just a very small area on the sink that can hold a toothbrush and toothpaste.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: great location and wonderful friendly service. the rooms and bathrooms were not up to my cleaning standards.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: do not book the times square view room. it is a waste of money. i got a room on a high floor and had to climb on to the desk to see a tiny part of times square. when i asked the front desk the manager told me this is new york they have high rises that may obstruct the view. location is convenient but can get noisy.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: the hotel use to chic, now it feels a bit tired and could use a bigger refresh. the staff is kind and helpful. times square use to be a cool hop location, now it’s just a big commercial tourist area.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: the hotel is actually really gross. dirty and outdated.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: excellent and courteous service, fun and youthful atmosphere, excellent hotel location, room quality a bit lower than w hotels i visited in the east.

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: great location. very close to rector str. subway station.

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: for a marriott, it meets all the location and aesthetic standards, however, the attention is cold from some of its staff.

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: our room was beautiful!

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: disappointing. room clean, bed comfy location quiet with s hudson view, but that's not the i gave it 2 starts, the stars are actually for lack of breakfast (yes i know they problem their billy whatever restaurant to do that👎. internet, well that's more complicated than cooking chinese at home. they have 5 different ssids to connect, one for when you're in the room, one for the lobby, another one as a guest, another one for conferences etc etc, plus speed is not waouh. and when you go out and come back... well you'll have to go through the process all over again.

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: very accommodating hotel rooms with excellent friendly front desk service and good staff. the view of the statue of liberty were fabulous.

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: great location!

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: clean, great service - really took care of us!

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: spacious rooms! my go to hotel when in nyc

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: good location. room 908 had been updated. guests in room 909 were extremely loud from 3pm - 10am. security and hotel staff were no help. connecting door between 909 and 908 was paper thin. lobby with the two chairs to sit and the attached shake shack style restaurant chain was uninspiring. service was fine — two friendly & two rude front desk members. upon checkin with luggage, door men stood and did not open the front door. was glad that i did not extend my stay and that i switched to the conrad hilton. played phone tag and exchanged 15 emails with management team to address concerns. refund issued which was appreciated. will be sure to pony up to conrad, ritz carlton nomad, or another fidi hotel the next time i’m in nyc. unlikely to return.

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: the staff was absolutely rude from start to finish the only the room was subpar for what we paid for the price you pay the staff is not welcome at all, and don’t get me started on the elevators there’s no parking and if you do park you have to pay 65 everytime to take your car in or out, we were part of a wedding party there and the were not welcoming at all chipped paint and no lighting in the bathroom

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: i paid 1500 for one night for wednesday in the bathroom at pubic hair and the view was horrible

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: this is a very middling hotel that is showing it's age unfortunately. if you are looking to be directly in times square it is good for that but the particular corner it is on directly adjacent to tkts makes it a hassle to get in and out of the hotel and to the subway even. the rooms are really showing their age (24 years) both in some wear and tear as well as the dated design. the finishes and materials lack the refinement of some of the better w properties. the edition across the avenue is a much nicer option and worth the additional spend. other things of note are the weirdly underutilized street level entrance lobby and some of the areas of the main lobby on the 7th floor. it makes it feel almost abandoned. the gym feels like a bit of an afterthought as it seems to be three hotel rooms turned into a workout space but in two disconnected spaces for no apparent reason. the saving grace here was the responsive and personable staff. otherwise, there are other properties that would be more worthwhile. hoping this property is slated for a much needed reno soon.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: smelly room, stains on carpet, and cockroaches!

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: great location for anything iconic in nyc.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: excellent and super friendly customer service. amazing valet staff including charlie and adam upstairs in the concierge. location is perfect for theatre district and times square area. would definitely stay there again.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: very central location, a stone's throw from times square, crowded during the day and even more so in the evening/night. precise room cleaning. there is a bar with music on floor 7, the reception floor.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews:
very nice hotel right on times square - which has advantages in terms of location, but also disadvantages in terms of noise. sound is pre-programmed throughout the evening and sometimes at night. otherwise, of course, perfectly located - for sightseeing as well as business.
the rooms are large by new york standards and, above all, clean and well furnished. there was absolutely nothing to complain about when it came to room service. you have to like the style with lots of colorful plastic. i was missing a few little things for the level, such as a shoe horn or the usual cotton pads etc. the bathroom is a bit small, but at least it has modern facilities and is clean.
the hotel itself is a bit old. the reception was friendly and helpful.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews:
i stayed in the corner room where full view of times square, i enjoyed it . this hotel located next block of times square.
i happy about the stay i selected with w new york- times square.

i am the marriott platinum customer, they have treated my family well and fulfilled all my requests ...
thank you fie the hotel team.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: service is great and you cannot find a better location than this! room is quite a bit outdated though and could use some renovations

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews:
husband & i did a 24hr staycation in the city. location is great! we did overnight self park at their suggested spot with no issues. valet is just double the price.

i do like how the elevator to the lobby is separate from the elevators that goes from the lobby to the rooms. staff are friendly. living room bar is nice. esthetically nice esp with those cozy nooks.

king bed city view room - we weren’t given a high floor but the view wasn’t bad. just wasn’t great. did wish we got a higher floor. the carpets were outdated, certain decor was peeling, bathroom metal vanity was quite rusted so we didn’t use the towels that were touching that metal vanity, but other than that, it was fine. i have pretty bad allergies so i noticed all the piled dust on tv, lighting features, bed frame and that little bed ledge that’s long enough to place your luggage. it’s not terrible but cleaning was bare minimum in my opinion.

noise from 19th floor - not too terrible. it’s alright but it’s time sq. what do you expect. it’s not noisy to the point that you can’t sleep and i’m a light sleeper, however, i was out until 4am so i ko pretty hard once it was time to sleep for a few hrs. housekeeping was very, very loud starting 9am. they basically were my alarm clock lol

nearby - we didn’t eat at the either two restaurants below the hotel bc we went somewhere else. blue fish seemed a bit busier than dos caminos but again, we didn’t eat there. there was a cvs not too far should you need stuff quickly.

during checkout, my husband was handling it, which i should’ve double checked. but by the time we left, i saw we were charged a gatorade, which we did purchase, but also a johnny walker, which we did not drink. we noticed there was only one johnny walker there but we assumed they were just out of one and forgot to restock. don’t feel like driving back nor dealing with an issue over the phone for that charge. just taking a loss for it, but next time, i will be taking a picture of the mini fridge, which i feel like i shouldn’t have to do, but just covering my grounds at least.

will i be staying here in the future? possibly and only if i can get a higher floor. it’s more of a last minute fall back if anything.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: good place to stay!

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: 4 stars for a 4 star hotel, that's it. the building interior was very cool and stylish but the service was average for the price.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews:
loved it
amazing if not one of the best locations
we got the room on 44th floor partially overlooking times square.
staff great, friendly and efficient.
rooms cosy and large for manhattan standard.
clean
modern
no fault.
would come back anytime.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: i stayed at the w this last week. the location is prime right in times square close to a bunch of places to eat a bunch of bars the theater where we saw our broadway show was right around the corner. easy access walking to a lot of different attractions easy to get a cab quick subway probably like a 15 minute walk to central park. the staff were very accommodating. this is not a five star hotel but it definitely had five star service room was clean and quite large for new york standards. the elevators were fast and they have a cute little bar in the lobby that has music and drinks. the restaurant caminos downstairs has really good mexican food and i’m from california and hispanic so i thought it was going to be trash but it was great. coming from someone who always stay in five star luxury hotels i was very pleased with my stay here so were my sisters. the service was great. one thing to keep in mind it’s right next to times square so it can be noisy at night at times because of the lively atmosphere

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: perfectly located to everything. nice staff, helped promptly and well. the room was adequately stocked and clean. we would definitely stay here again.

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews: location was amazing 🤩 right outside of time square! the lounge was amazing

title: W New York - Times Square
Reviews:
nice hotel, nice views, clean rooms and classy like most w’s.
upgraded corner king room is nice.

excellent location, right on times square. the rooms have times square or hudson river views (corner rooms on higher floor)

the service is friendly. the room service menu is nice, especially the breakfast egg n cheese on a croissant, the chicken tortilla soup, quesadillas, wings and fries. you can also order from the blue fish (sushi) and mexican place.

a great hotel if you want to enjoy the times square experience.

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews: bald manger of phd is very rude . as a guest of the hotel i didn’t expect to be treated with disrespect to enjoy the hotel amenities. he didn’t want to give me his name which shows he can’t take accountability as a manager if he was that.

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews: i moved here in july 1996 back then it was the covenant house. my room # was 724 and i paid $25.00 a week for rent. i 😍 my view and the round windows, the building was always slanted. this building bring back so many memories.

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews: i had the pleasure of visiting dream downtown. the moment i arrived the jess greeted me with a warm welcoming hello and smile. as i struggled to open the umbrella may came over and immediately helped! they both made my day of relaxation a pleasant experience.

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews: didn’t stay in the hotel but came to visit the pool, jess & may were absolutely beyond nice & helpful once i walked in :)! love people like this and appreciate staff that provides such great service!

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews: hotel looked beautiful so i called to ask about adding an extra guest to a king bed room (the website says you can for an added charge). the man on the phone barked at me saying they can't do that even after i asked about the added fee and then hung up on me. i would have booked the room with two beds if he hadn't done so!

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews: great service. particularly by amit at the pool, thanks amit!

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews:
i'd not recommend staying here unless you plan to sleep after 4 am.

the hotel has two towers; one tower is taller and has a club on the 12th floor. the club operates until 4 am everyday except monday and tuesday (unless they have private events). the bass can be felt on the 9th floor. i have my ear plugs and a white noise but i still cannot sleep. the bed vibrate and i can hear all the beats.

the room is pretty interesting, but i'd say they are very gimmicky and very annoying instead of being nice. the light controls are laid out in a way that you need a diagram to operate. and the buttons do not dim at night. the noise isolation between rooms is bad and on par with other ny hyatt hotels. for example, you can hear all the doors slamming every morning, as usual.

although the room looks old, in my opinion, it feels cleaner than other hyatt i stayed at in ny. so i guess that's a plus.

the bathroom is spacious for a ny hotel room and the water pressure is generous. although the toilet is a bit too tall for my liking and it does not soft close.

adequate amount of elevators.

the location is nice but it's not a redeeming quality due to the excessive noise from the club.

in short, avoid this hotel unless you are here to party until 4 am.

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews:
i would rate negative zero stars if i could. i can see why their rating has dropped to 3.9 stars from 4.8..

so many issues i’m unsure where to begin, we checked out early as the staff was so rude and unpleasant and made the end of our stay unpleasant. then they had the audacity to charge me thousands of dollars extra even though we did not break any policies.

there were damages in the room prior to us occupying it which we do have video reference of. there were also no hot water in two sinks…. in the 4500 per night king guest suite!

we were also falsely accused of smoking in the room, which we did not.. as well as leaving trash in the room… as the garbage was left by the door for housekeeping to collect. we requested house keeping prior to departure and we were not accommodated.

there were absolutely no broken items left by our behalf, and we were falsely accused and charged for that too with no evidence provided.

i requested a copy of the bill and also asked them provide evidentiary support of what they charged us for, showing the dates and details for my records, as i need my legal advisor to review at this point, as they refused to adjust my bill or even provide me with a formal copy.

and please note their establishment has become anything but high-quality, and i wouldn’t want to stay at dream downtown again after the awful experience we had. we had to check out more than two days early because the staff made our stay so uncomfortable and it was an extreme inconvenience. my niece also flew back to north carolina early due to the unpleasant stay. this was for my sisters birthday and a networking event for a major artist i couldn’t event have there due to non working speakers and a less than accommodating staff.. which i had to book elsewhere last minute - and almost lost my job over it.

the only person on their staff who was so pleasant and made our stay comfortable and was always accommodating was latrell (front desk). he was very sincere and accommodating and reflects how a hospitality specialist should be and treat customers. shout out to latrell!!!!!

as mentioned in my original complaint inquiry, i had to book a suite at a an actual high-quality hotel for a major artist networking conference event last minute due to their “engineer” not being able to fix the ceiling speakers. absolutely absurd.

we were also accused of playing loud music by security, and didn’t even have working speakers at the time to have done so……

we spent about 20 grand in their establishment over the weeks we were there and did not break any of their policies and this is an extremely horrible way to treat customers.

#getittogether !

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews:
the design and the vibe of the place… everything feels modern, relaxed, and still has that touch of luxury that makes you feel special.
huge thanks to the entire team for their great service. we’ll definitely be back!

we love staying at the dream hotel because it’s in the perfect location—right in chelsea, in the heart of the meatpacking district, where there’s always so much to do.
there are amazing bars for nightlife, stunning rooftops, and the hotel itself has a pool and a very cool poolside area—perfect for relaxing and enjoying the atmosphere.

the service was excellent, the cocktails were really well made, and the energy of the place just feels special.

on top of that, the location is super convenient: just one block from chelsea market, and one or two blocks from several top-notch restaurants where you can enjoy a refined dinner. these are trendy, high-quality spots that are really worth visiting.

the neighborhood feels very safe and walkable, even at night.
overall, the stay was amazing. in fact, this is our third time staying here! we always choose this hotel for special occasions, and we’ll definitely keep coming back because we love it so much.

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews: great location, highly recommend. stay on the lower floors if you are a light sleeper and don’t want to hear the base from upstairs… i stayed on the 9th… i didn’t hear noise so staying on the 9th floor was no problem for me.

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews:
shoutout to rosie at the front desk! she made this stay incredibly special, provided excellent recommendations for places to check out around the city, and provided top notch customer service.

updating my review may 2025: stayed here again, and latrell and paul at the front desk made this experience absolutely incredible. the rooms are spacious, and the location of the hotel itself is prime. also the pool was open during our stay and whoever had the aux knew what they were doing. i quite literally will only stay at dream downtown when i'm in ny.
Owner Response: Kiara, it's wonderful to hear you had a great time at Dream Downtown, by Hyatt. Your praise for Rosie's excellent recommendations and service is greatly appreciated. We're glad she was able to elevate your stay and enable you to explore the city with confidence. Thank you for choosing us. We eagerly look forward to your next visit.

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews: i want to congratulate marelis and camry for their excellent service. she was kind, professional, and very attentive at all times. it's clear she enjoys what she does and her cordial treatment really made a difference. people like her make the experience so much better. thank you, marelis!

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews: ...nice cool place to stay in mid manhattan!

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews: jay and seth are nothing short of amazing!! they helped their guest tremendously 💙

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews: we selected dream downtown due to proximity to chelsea piers for our hockey tournament. the location was ideal for us and there was plenty to do/eat within a short walking distance during our down time. the room itself was satisfactory. the design was fun and there was decent space for an nyc hotel. the switches for the lighting were a bit wonky - buttons instead of usual flip-switches and they weren't responsive. our issue, and when we go back next year we'll plan better, was that our room was on the 11th floor right under a nightclub. this was not disclosed during the reservation nor at check in. the only warning we received was 2 packs of earplugs and a note saying there was a nightclub above us on the nightstand. our friday/saturday nights were not entirely restful.

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews:
the worst service ever. there is no on site convenience store, and the coffee shop closes really early. if you’re thirsty for anything besides water, good luck. we had our orders taken at the lobby bar and the bartender never came back. in fact, they just closed up and didn’t even tell us.

check-in day was awful. the first person said i had to wait for a manager. i waited thinking they would find the manager for me, but instead i had to go back to the front desk and wait in line again. the service at the desk has to be the worst people i have ever dealt with at a ny hotel at this price point. also, i was told late checkout was not available even for globalists

we checked multiple times for slippers until they finally called to inform us they were “out of slippers”

the hotel hosts a rooftop bar but they are not associated with the property. there are no perks for the guests who stay here. the first night wasn’t even busy, but they wanted $300 min spend. the second night it was closed for a private party. next door is tao and several other nice establishments.

the only nice thing to say about this place is the location is pretty convenient. there are plenty of bars and food options nearby.

the suite is misrepresented on the website, as there is only one king bed and one murphy bed. the espresso machine was dirty. the private terrace hot tub made it worth it. but still, i cannot recommend this place in its current state. also, the tv barely worked. no other amenities. dollar store soap. the blinds were broken. the tablet doesn’t work. the couch has “stains”

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews:
great place to enjoy yourself & have great vibes.
customer service is great. food is amazing !

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews:
scammers. hotel was nice but some of the employees are scammers.

as i was leaving, a tall gentleman who works there is like “bro lemme get you a taxi it’s cheaper than an uber”

it was not cheaper than an uber and i’m guessing he’s getting kickbacks from the taxi drivers. disgusting

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews: i love this hotel. dream is definitely a dream. the staff is immaculate. specifically shout out to sandra, she is awesome. my fiance and i visited dream in march and she made sure to give us top notch service back then. now in may she did a phenomenal job. this shows that she is consistent and that is great thing. i also want to shout out seth, nick,and jannett because they did a great job assisting and helping us. everyone has a great personality. we will continue to stay at dream hotel because the service is what you want when you have been traveling for hours. well done !!!

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: family of 4. rooms were nice sized and very clean. staff were helpful and friendly. location was great and within walking distance to all the sights we wanted to see. would stay here again!

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews:
arrived with a reservation at midnight, no rooms available and when asked the receptionist responded with ‘we are working on it’ for 1 hr with no eta.
worst possible experience - never staying here again.

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews:
this was a gift from our kids for the weekend 2/21/25 -2/23/25. i have been to nyc before, but was my husband's 1st visit. within an hour of arriving at the hotel, my husband realized that he had lost his phone in the taxi. the 2 women at the front desk (late morning/ afternoon shift for that friday) took him through steps to get it back which he followed. within the hour, he got the phone back. specifically, those 2 women (they did write their names down, but, unfortunately, can't find their names) knew their jobs, very kind, professional, and both are assets. shout out to every doorman during our visit, too! all were kind, professional, and accomodating. they went above & beyond!
the location of the hotel is wonderful! i am sure downtown is more crowded during the work week, but the weekend crowds were manageable.
the hotel itself is clean & beautiful. the views were wonderful from the 26th floor!
thank you! thank you! all-around wonderful trip

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: great location, clean room, good service. you can view one world trade in the room

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: i stay here for work and norman, idris, and the rest of the staff make me feel like a celebrity every time i stay. that’s just heir level of service. norman helped me carry boxes of work material and saved my aching shoulders from further damage. much gratitude!

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: the room is kinda old, the service is on par but the freaking cleaning crew knocked on my door for 3 times in the morning, geez please do better….. horrible experience

title: New York Marriott Downtown
Reviews: best location if in town for business

title: Hyatt Place New York City / Times Square
Reviews: the room was over 300$ and the thermostat didn’t work we tried to sleep in 80° heat engineering never came to fix it. do not stay here. it’s a fake boujee hotel it’s actually mad ghetto

title: Hyatt Place New York City / Times Square
Reviews:
disappointed by service.
we recently stayed at this property and while the cleanliness of the property and the location were satisfactory, the overall experience fell short due to poor service standards, especially at the front desk. we had reserved a room for four, yet on one of the days, housekeeping left only 3 towels and when we called the front desk to request a fourth towel, we were told we’d have to wait until 9.30am when the housekeeping staff shift begins. this level of inflexibility and lack of basic guest support was both disappointing and unexpected from a brand like hyatt. the buffet breakfast was another let down. the spread was quite limited and completely overwhelmed by the sheer number of guests. there weren’t enough tables to accommodate everyone leading to a chaotic and uncomfortable dining experience. to make the things worse, they began winding down breakfast even before the official closing time.

title: Hyatt Place New York City / Times Square
Reviews: if i can give 0 star, i will give 0 star. the front desk is so trashy, irresponsible and has no knowledge of what they are doing. don’t spend money or your time here. for your questions, they can only give you random answers and in the end you only receive bill which you are not responsible for. instead of solving problems, they will only throw you to others for answers. plus, they always have very long wait before you can be connected on the call. they also hang up on you for no reasons. don’t come. you will be sad

title: Hyatt Place New York City / Times Square
Reviews: my first trip to new york city for my 50th birthday was absolutely incredible. i was truly impressed with my stay at the hotel. i was on the 25th floor and had a breathtaking view of the city. everything was within walking distance, including the port authority bus terminal, the theater district, times square, central park, and the empire state building. the staff were friendly and professional. when i had an issue with my window, it was addressed immediately. they even texted me to ask if i needed any further assistance. the breakfast bar was charming, but they didn’t have a waffle maker. regardless, everything else was fantastic! whenever i return to nyc, i will definitely stay here again.

title: Hyatt Place New York City / Times Square
Reviews:
i’m quite disappointed with my stay, especially considering the price i paid. while the hotel is rated 4 stars, it certainly doesn’t live up to that standard. the location is great—no complaints there—but there are two other hotels nearby that i now regret not choosing instead.

one major issue: do not touch the complimentary water bottles in the room. there was a note saying they would be charged at $6 each unless you're a world of hyatt member—in which case they're free. i am a member, and yet i was still charged $18. to make matters worse, there's an additional $89 charge on my credit card that i still haven’t received an explanation for. it’s currently being investigated.

breakfast was decent, but getting to it was an ordeal. first, there’s the wait for the elevator—an average of 30 minutes just to get one with enough space to enter safely. the alternative is taking the stairs. once you finally arrive at the canteen, it’s overcrowded and chaotic. you’ll likely have to stand and wait another 30 minutes just to find a free table.

the lobby is no better. it’s constantly packed, day and night, with loud music playing nonstop—far from ideal when you're trying to relax or wait for a transfer or taxi.

overall, despite the hotel clearly generating a lot of income, the service and experience fall far short. i wouldn’t recommend staying here. look elsewhere.

title: Hyatt Place New York City / Times Square
Reviews:
my partner, our 10-year-old daughter and i were visiting new york for a week, and after evaluating many options, we decided on the hyatt place new york city and we couldn't be happier with our decision.

the combination of location, comfort of the facilities, attention and professionalism of the hotel staff, and quality and variety of the free breakfast buffet is excellent.

we booked a room on a high floor, and what a success! absolute tranquility, and spectacular views. for the price difference, it's totally worth it.

it is true that the rooms could be a little bigger, but we saw that it was the standard for the area, and they were very clean, modern and functional.

the double bed was very comfortable, and the sofa bed, enough for our daughter, although i doubt it would be suitable for an adult.

the bathroom was small, but the shower, perfect, with very good pressure, and we were on the 24th of 26th floor.

there were 4 elevators, and we never had to wait too long to take one. obviously, if you want to use it when the whole hotel goes down at the last minute for breakfast, things can change. the breakfast buffet time slots and their attendance are indicated on the lift doors themselves. common sense

the free buffet was plentiful and varied, with different choices of breads, coffee, tea, infusions and milk. various machine juice options. butters, jams, cream cheese, etc. you had options to make your breakfast as hearty as you like, with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, creilles, hard-boiled eggs, etc. but there were also healthier options, and they changed the fresh fruit option daily, with apples or bananas. and there was always melon, pineapple and grape fruit salad, as well as a bowl of red fruit and another bowl of natural yoghurt.

wow, you were never hungry. we had a good breakfast and went out to visit the city well fed!

the hotel is just a few streets away from many points of interest, such as madison square garden, high line park, vessel, little island, bryant park and the nyc public library, times square, the summit, rockefeller center and a long et cetera.

and it is close to the 42nd street bus station and metro stations. you couldn't be better connected. in a few stops you were in central park and its museums, or in the area of ​​dumbo, brooklyn, wall street.

finally, highlight the hotel staff. simply perfect. they were there for everything, took care of the details and were very kind. an 11 out of 10 for them.

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews:
the only positive thing about this hotel is the location next to chelsea market - everything else is a disaster. this hotel is for you if:

1. you hate sleeping: the hotel is located directly next to a nightclub, which makes it impossible to sleep. the hotel fails to disclose this during booking or check-in and only leaves a note + earplugs on the nightstand as a warning sign

2. you hate privacy: a good majority of the rooms in this property are facing each other in the inner courtyard within very close proximity, but the windows don't have privacy tinting or have light filtering curtains. it is not uncommon to see other guests walking around in the nude in their rooms unaware that everyone else in the property can see them

3. you hate convenience: however designed this property should permanently retire from the hospitality business before wrecking more havoc. light switches? no, forget about that lets just add a bunch of fancy buttons with complicated instructions for turning off the lights. garbage cans in the room? nope that is too archaic for this property. a towel rack? no, let's just add a ladder shelf that isn't attached to the wall to hang the towels and have our guests get hit by this massive wooden rack that isn't anchored to any fixed structure. need to rinse your mouth after brushing your teeth? nope nevermind the bathroom faucet is in the middle of a large gaping pipe that will cause you to hit your head if you try to drink water.

make yourself a favor and stay away from this hotel unless you absolutely have no other option.

one of the worst hotel experiences i’ve ever had — deceptive, arrogant, and openly hostile to customers.

booked two rooms at dream hotel downtown. tried to cancel less than two hours later — hotel refused. first they said they’d charge one night, then changed it to all three.

hotels can have policies, but in all my years of traveling, i’ve never seen a place treat customer service like a joke — and laugh while doing it.

they clearly hoped we’d cancel so they could resell the room and keep our money. when i showed up in person, the front desk manager played a smug game of “not my department.” hyatt’s own support confirmed they had the power to fix it — they just chose not to.

and if you do stay? good luck sleeping. there’s a nightclub on the 12th floor that makes your entire room shake. their solution? a note and a pair of foam earplugs.

as hundreds of other bad reviews will show you: this hotel is all vibe, no ethics. avoid it.

it sucks. like it really really sucks. worst hyatt property i’ve stayed at probably ever, maybe not quite as bad as the rio vegas pre-renovation masquerade tower. i have no idea why hyatt acquired the dream hotel group.

it feels like a brothel for tao guests (nightclub next door on the first floor) disguised as a hotel more so than a hotel. it’s like the cosmopolitan meets motel 6. the halls and room decor are in rough shape, all the floors and furniture have been abused with no repair and refurbishment. marks everywhere, carpet in the room is super gross. ac is completely broken. fan putters for about 5 seconds then gives up when you try to turn it on. bed feels like a super bad, saggy sofa bed. shower has this super weird design choice chain mail curtain that is beyond modern edgy and into dungeon territory.

if you come here to check it off on the woh brand explorer like i did, just stay for one night and plan a late night out and early exit to minimize time actually spent at this place. my advice to hyatt is renovate it and actually care about the property or sell it and have another developer convert it into something else.

room size not correct with photos. we booked a king size room of 19m2, but the room we got seemed about 13-14m2, no sofa, very small sink, like hand basin. the shower is similar to a high pressure jet and the intensity is not adjustable.
there is a portable water fountain for each floor but the water comes out a weird color so is not portable at all. there are 2 small bottles of water in the room but no price list, so we assumed it was free (like the 4* hotels we have stayed in around the world). we were unpleasantly surprised that he charged $6 per small bottle.
our room is at the end of a corridor, there are always 2 towel storage trolleys in the 1m corridor (60cm wide trolley) so there is not much traffic. not great.
the service: very unfriendly and requires a mandatory bank imprint
breakfast: passable but a lot of people and waiting, less choice, served with plastic plates, knives, forks, not at all up to the standard of a 4-star hotel.
disappointed and never going back again.

i visited hayat palace in manhattan last week on a weekday, hoping for a smooth experience. unfortunately, despite it being a weekday, the place was still quite crowded.

on a positive note, the room itself was clean, comfortable, and well-maintained. if the staff coordination and communication improve, the overall experience could be much better.

title: Dream Downtown, by Hyatt
Reviews:
i stayed at the dream hotel last week for two nights with my 14 year old son. we were headed to a business trip in new jersey over his spring break and i wanted to show him around new york for a few days.

i loved the location of the dream hotel, but this being new york and it being a chain hotel i just wasn't expecting a lot in the way of over the top service (no offense to ny'ers, please!).

i have to say, i was totally blown away by the level of service. it felt like i was at a family owned hotel in a small town or the mountains or something. everyone was so incredibly nice to me - i couldn't believe it. a few people in particular stood out.

first was the general manager, sean. we didn't even know he was the gm when he started talking with us while we were waiting for the front desk. he was so friendly - asking us about our stay and where we were from and then connecting with us. he asked us what kind of food we were looking for and had so many great recommendation for pizza, donuts and even where to go for the best milkshake (my son's favorite thing to have!) just the way he took his time with us and spoke so kindly to my son really made us feel so welcome and like we were part of a family. i really can't recall being treated so kindly at any hotel and it was totally unexpected.

another person who stood out to me was oeteka. she had been working the night shift when we saw her at night and then we saw her again the next morning. i would have expected her to be so tired and just ready to go home, but she was instead incredibly friendly. she kept talking to my son, asking him what he was doing and how he was liking ny and offering friendly suggestions. i asked her how she could have so much positive energy after such a long overnight shift and she said "i just really love my job!". honestly hyatt is so incredibly lucky to have someone with such a great attitude.

thank you sean and oeteka for such a great stay and all the warmth you showed me and my son! it honestly felt like both of you were owners of the hotel with the pride you took in your work - it was totally unexpected and it really blew me away.

title: Warwick New York
Reviews:
i booked a one bedroom suite for three nights and here is a list of the pros and cons that i observed. i was in the warwick suite on the 33rd floor.
pros:
1. great location! this hotel allows you an easy walk to central park, rockefeller center, 5th avenue for shopping and broadway plays.
2. staff was very friendly. everyone we encountered was extremely nice
3. good restaurant in the hotel. it is only open for breakfast and is a bit on the expensive side....but the food was very good.
4. very good room pricing
5. very large rooms for nyc
6. clean rooms
7. no observed bugs
cons:
1. very noisy. no, not from the street but from the hvac system (at least i think that is what the noise was coming from). there was a constant noise day and night. made sleeping a challenge.
2. very low water pressure
3. tiny elevators (6 people max) that were very slow and only two of the three elevators went to our floor.
4. in 1965 and 1966, the beatles stayed at the warwick....no that's not a negative. the negative is that based on our suite, the furniture is still the same stuff from the band's visit. in other words...the furniture, lamps, and paint on the walls are all very old and desperately in need of a refresh! the furniture was all scratched, paint coming off, and looked like it was literally 50 - 60 years old! i sat on the sofa in the living room and felt like there was no support at all. i was afraid that i was going to end up sinking to the floor (and i am truly not a heavy person).

i posted a few photos to illustrate my point. the first and second show the chipped and damaged furniture and the third shows the chips in the paint on the walls.

in summary, this place needs some tlc...and soon!

i'm truly sorry to have to give this hotel so many negatives...the people are very nice and, as i indicated, its in a truly excellent location, but it is incredibly run down. invest in some new furniture, carpeting and paint and this place would be amazing!

if i have to "warn" folks about this hotel, please do not ever reserve a room with them because i have the displeasure of requesting reversal of charges made to my credit card.

background info, when i made reservation for april 26, 2025 to april 29, 2025 on january 27, 2025, it clearly states on my confirmation that the hotel's cancellation policy is free cancellation and changeable up to 11:59 pm hotel local time, 1 day prior to arrival. with this in mind, i have up to april 25, 2025 11:59 pm (ok, i'll give the hotel benefit of doubt this could be interpreted as april 24, 2025 11:59 pm) to cancel my reservation.

on april 12, 2025 (or april 13, 2025), i used the hotel's system to cancel my reservation. my mistake was probably not to speak to a live person but with today's technology, i figured that i could cancel said reservation on my own, without hotel staff assistance. i checked several times if my reservation was cancelled and after several confirmation, i was assured the cancellation went through.

on april 29, 2025, i was looking at my credit card charges and i spotted a charge of $502.67 from warwick new york hotel. i immediately sent the hotel all the supporting documentation that the cancellation was made all within the time frame of the hotel's cancellation policy. on may 1, 2025, i received an email stating that my inquiry has been forwarded to front desk director for review. i have not heard from the hotel since then nor has there been an attempt to reverse the charges made by this hotel to my credit card.

i have to say that i am very displeased with warwick new york hotel for first, not honoring their own hotel cancellation policy, second for charging my credit card (and not checking their system for my cancellation since i was a no-show), and third for treating me like i don't matter.

if i could give this hotel a 0, i would. please don't ever make a reservation with this hotel because they don't honor their own cancellation policy if you have to cancel.

title: Warwick New York
Reviews:
my family and i just spent nearly a week at this hotel and i want to break down each part of this awesome experience.
1. facilities / premises: this beautiful historic hotel has old world charm with current updates and technological resources without losing its original character. when you first walk in the lobby is absolutely beautiful. other reviews have complained about the lobby being small, but this hotel is about 100 years old, super large lobbies weren't so popular back then. the premises were clean, neat and well decorated with a lot of history and interesting back stories. i stayed in a one bedroom suite and it was incredibly beautiful. the suite was spacious, clean, and just very pretty. the furniture was comfortable and very nice and there was a lot of closet and storage space. the beds were roomy and very comfortable. we all had amazing restful nights during our visit. the bathroom was full of beautiful warm toned marble throughout. the tub / shower was spacious, the mirror was large, and the toilet and sink were always cleaned by the staff every morning. there were plenty of outlets and charging stations throughout the suite so we didn't have to jumble so many charging cords and plugs in one unit. the dorm sized refrigerator was surprisingly spacious and well hidden in the entertainment center. although there were a lot of updates to accommodate today's needs and technology, the warwick never lost it's historic charm and character which i enjoyed a lot. there are a few elevators, and they are small, so expect to bypass a few rides on move out days because more than likely the elevators will be full (which is expected), but it was never a very long wait, and we were never in a rush.

there is a gym and i was pleasantly surprised at just how roomy it was. it has the basic (very updated) workout equipment but there were a lot of clean towels readily available and there was enough space in between the equipment so you wouldn't bump into an exercising neighbor.

2. service / staff: i cannot say enough about the staff and the service. one evening we were walking back into the hotel from being out all day, and the first thing a staff member said to us was "welcome back home," and that is what it really felt like, a home away from home. everyone was professional, accommodating, helpful, kind, and it really seemed like everyone enjoyed their jobs. i felt so spoiled during my short stay and it was amazing. anything we needed, the staff accommodated for us and if it was something the hotel did not have, they did their best to try to get it for us. it was really just an awesome experience. the cleaning staff was quick, efficient, accommodating, and patient (especially when we weren't ready for the room to be cleaned). also, the front desk staff was knowledgeable about the city and the sites to visit and places to enjoy. it was as if they went completely out of their way to ensure this was an amazing vacation.

3. a few cons: there is no microwave. i know this is trivial, but when you bring home the amazing food from these incredible new york restaurants, you want to look forward to warm leftovers. unfortunately, they do not have a microwave on the premises, but the staff tried to give me ideas of places that may have a public microwave nearby to use, and i appreciate that so very much. so if you go out to eat, make sure you remember that you probably can't warm up your food for a later time. another draw back is there is no shuttle between the warwick and the airports. it's not a big deal, but be mindful when you check out, to give yourself extra time (and extra budget) to secure transportation to the airport.

overall, this was an amazing visit at an equally amazing hotel. everything was just absolutely perfect, and i am certain i will use this hotel again on all of our visits to new york. my new york home away from home.

lastly, after paying likely $200 or so per night, the hotel will help you forget that you did that by pretending instead to be a budget hotel and attempting to charge you $4 per item for storage on the day of checking out because you dared to ask them to put your bags in a room for a couple of hours after spending over a $1000 to stay there. as a silver lining, being nickel and dimed right at the end of our time here helped us forget about all the other stressful parts of checking out.

title: Hyatt Grand Central New York
Reviews:
absolutely phenomenal experience at the grand hyatt new york at grand central — truly an iconic gem in the heart of manhattan!

from the moment i stepped in, i was enveloped in timeless elegance and energy that mirrors the very soul of new york city. what sets this hotel apart, beyond its impeccable service and stunning interiors, is its unbeatable location. it’s not just near grand central station — it feels like a seamless extension of it. that kind of access isn’t just convenient, it’s integral to the rhythm of real new york living. trains, subways, taxis — everything pulses right at your doorstep. the convenience made my entire stay feel dynamic, efficient, and effortlessly luxurious.

the rooms? spacious, spotless, and stylishly modern with just the right touch of classic nyc sophistication. every detail, from the plush bedding to the skyline views, felt intentionally designed to elevate your stay.

staff went above and beyond — genuinely warm, attentive, and quick to respond to any request. whether it was a late-night food recommendation or help navigating the city, their hospitality never missed a beat.

staying here wasn’t just a visit — it was an experience. it made me feel like a real new yorker, fully immersed in the city’s pulse, and i can’t imagine coming back to the city without staying here again. a glowing five stars — if i could give it more, i would.

the grand hyatt new york at grand central boasts a rich architectural history. originally opened in 1919 as the commodore hotel, it was designed by the esteemed architectural firm warren & wetmore, who also co-designed the adjacent grand central terminal. in the late 1970s, real estate developer donald trump, in partnership with hyatt hotels, undertook a significant renovation of the property. this transformation, completed in 1980, was led by the architectural firm gruzen & partners, with architect der scutt serving as a design consultant. scutt later gained prominence for designing trump tower. the renovation introduced a sleek glass façade, modernizing the hotel’s appearance while maintaining its iconic status in the cityscape. ￼

pros: soft bed, cold fridge, decent workspace, and eventually got towels when requested. located above/side of grand central.

overall, it is not up to hyatt standards. great location doesn’t excuse poor service and lack of care. definitely won’t stay again.

title: Sheraton New York Times Square Hotel
Reviews:
the good, the bad, & the ugly — a classic clint eastwood experience at sheraton times square

the good:
our stay at the sheraton times square came with standout service from several exceptional staff members. ahmed welcomed us warmly at check-in and set a great tone. kendra, the concierge, was outstanding—going above and beyond to provide helpful information and personalized service. jimmy at the bell desk was equally impressive—friendly, efficient, and accommodating.

the elevator system is one of the most efficient i’ve seen in a high-rise hotel—smart panel controls that keep things moving smoothly even during busy hours.

we did our homework before booking, and this sheraton proved to be one of the best values in times square. its central location, pricing, and amenities clearly appeal to travelers, as evidenced by the consistent lines at both the front desk and concierge.

our room was clean, comfortable, and provided the rest we needed.

the bad:
the long lines at registration were a recurring issue—almost every time we passed by, guests were waiting. while it speaks to the hotel’s popularity, it does affect convenience.

construction at the primary entrance was a bit of an inconvenience, but not a deal-breaker.

housekeeping responded quickly when we reported an unpleasant odor and visible mold on the shower liner, but it should have been addressed proactively before check-in.

the ugly:
unfortunately, our experience with one staff member, samuel, was repeatedly negative. over a short two-night stay, we witnessed multiple incidents where he was aggressive, dismissive, and outright rude to both guests and his colleagues. his behavior during a simple inquiry about water was unnecessarily hostile, and i observed him shouting at other guests and staff on multiple occasions. in my opinion, samuel is not suited for a customer-facing role, and his conduct was a sharp contrast to the otherwise professional staff.

overall:
despite a few bumps, our stay was enjoyable and well worth the price. most of the staff were excellent, and the location can’t be beat. if management addresses the front desk efficiency and takes a serious look at how guests are treated across the board, this sheraton could easily earn five stars.

title: Hilton New York Times Square
Reviews:
my stay at the hilton new york times square was, overall, a deeply disappointing experience. from the moment i reached out to the hotel, it felt like every interaction was designed to squeeze more money out of me. i emailed to request an early check-in, only to receive a curt response informing me it would cost an extra $100. this set the tone for what felt like a relentless push to upsell at every turn.

fortunately, at check-in, someone recognized my diamond status, and the early check-in was made complimentary, which was a small relief. george at the front desk was a bright spot—he provided the wi-fi password for diamond members, handed me two water bottles, and informed me about my $18 credit. however, the credit didn’t go far, as the options to use it were limited and overpriced.

to make matters worse, they placed me on a low floor, even though i later learned other rooms were available. i didn’t expect an upgrade—room upgrades in the u.s. seem to be a thing of the past—but it felt like a deliberate choice to stick me in a less desirable room. the room itself was just okay, but noticeably dusty, which added to the overall sense of neglect.

the issues continued with housekeeping. at 9 a.m., they knocked on my door for no apparent reason, claiming they needed to "check on the room." why? it was intrusive and unnecessary. i requested a noon checkout, but they still knocked at 11 a.m., completely disregarding my request. this lack of attention to basic guest preferences was frustrating.

the hotel’s location in times square is prime, but it’s tucked away in an annoying alleyway, making it a hassle to get in and out of the property. it’s clear they rely on this optimal location to drive revenue without prioritizing guest experience. as a hilton loyalist, i felt like just another number, not a valued customer. there’s zero effort to make guests feel cared for—it’s all about maximizing profit.

the on-site long acre market was another low point. the sandwiches were overpriced and overheated, and the staff was outright rude when i asked for recommendations. a large coffee cost an absurd $12. i quickly decided to skip the hotel’s high rise buffet entirely and eat outside, which was a much better choice.

ultimately, i wouldn’t recommend the hilton new york times square to anyone. the combination of poor customer service, constant upcharges, subpar room assignment, and a general disregard for guest comfort makes this a place to avoid, despite its central location.

title: Hotel Indigo Lower East Side New York by IHG

dates thanksgiving weekend 2023.

from the moment we stepped into the lee quiñones graffiti-adorned lobby, hotel indigo lower east side radiated nyc cool with a touch of boutique charm. it wasn't just the location (walking distance to trendy hotspots and historic gems) or the stunning manhattan views from our room; it was the soul of the place that truly captivated us.

**design that dazzles:** our room was an urban haven – hardwood floors, plush linens, and rainfall showers were just the beginning. local art adorned the walls, and the keurig coffee maker was a delightful surprise. but the crown jewel? the rooftop pool overlooking the city skyline – sunrise swims and sunset cocktails became instant rituals.

**service with a smile (and citi bike passes):** the staff were the epitome of nyc hospitality – friendly, informative, and always willing to go the extra mile. the complimentary amenity fee included everything from citi bike passes (exploring the city on two wheels was a blast!) to a $20 minibar credit. talk about value! kenny and others made sure we were more than welcomed and made us feel special from the first minute until our check out.

** room: **
kenny helped us get a room on 23rd floor and it was more than we could ask for. the bathroom had a heated floor and shower with a view of new york city skyline (the edge and neighborhood was visible when you took shower). room size was amazing for new york and tall windows had about 250 degrees view of the new york city. minimalistic furniture made it all more so elegant.

**neighborhood nirvana:** hotel indigo isn't just a hotel; it's a gateway to the vibrant lower east side. we were steps away from trendy cafes, buzzing nightlife, and cool street art. the hotel even offered curated neighborhood guides, leading us to hidden gems like a vintage clothing store and a rooftop bar with killer views.

**foodie nirvana:** the onsite restaurant, mr. purple, was a culinary highlight. from the melt-in-your-mouth avocado toast at breakfast to the creative small plates for dinner, each dish was a delicious ode to the neighborhood's multicultural influence.

**leaving a piece of our hearts:** checking out was bittersweet. hotel indigo wasn't just a place to stay; it was an experience. we left feeling like we'd discovered a secret corner of nyc and made new friends in the staff. this is more than a 5-star hotel; it's a lower east side love letter, and we can't wait to write our next chapter at hotel indigo.

**p.s.** don't miss the rooftop pool at sunset; it's pure magic!

Reviews:
my recent stay at the marriott marquis times square was one of the most stressful and poorly handled hotel experiences i’ve ever had.

upon check-in, after a long day of delayed flights…i was told that marriott had not received payment from my travel company, even though that payment had been submitted on april 1st. my travel provider confirmed that the card authorization had been sent well in advance, but marriott staff, particularly a manager named grace, insisted they had nothing on file. rather than working with me to sort things out, grace was cold, dismissive, and completely unhelpful. there was no empathy, no flexibility, and no effort to problem-solve, only condescension and an ultimatum that if they didn’t receive payment by a certain time, i would lose my room.

because it was 9:30 pm and my travel provider was only available for emergencies after-hours, there was no easy way to resolve it immediately. i was left with no option but to put a night on my personal card just to avoid being stranded after a full day of travel.

then came the checkout issue. although a hold had been placed on my personal credit card, nothing on my checkout itinerary reflected that charge. i had no documentation…no proof that it had even been processed….and staff initially said they couldn’t provide anything to show that amount or authorization. it took over 30 minutes of standing at the desk before someone finally generated a code and a note with the amount that would eventually be credited.

all of this could have been avoided with better communication, basic hospitality, and a willingness to help. instead, i was met with resistance and indifference at every step. at a property as prominent as the marriott marquis, i expected far better.

i won’t be returning to this hotel, and i’ll be advising my company to reconsider using it for business travel. being treated like a burden after doing nothing wrong is simply unacceptable.

title: Marriott Vacation Club, New York City
Reviews:
i was invited to book a short stay at the mvc for a reduced fee, if i agreed to sit through a sales presentation. i was reluctant, but agreed, and booked the trip. upon booking, i was talked into this location because of the fantastic upgrades that had recently occurred, included a rooftop bar. i imagined enjoying some pre-dinner or possibly even late night cocktails there, so i locked in my trip at mvc, nyc. well...i guess i shouldn't have gotten too excited. we arrived on sunday, and left wednesday, and the rooftop bar was closed the entire time!! so disappointing!! then, to make matters worse there were some other issues i'd like to share so that you can make an informed choice as to whether or not this is the place for you.
the lighting in the room was dismal. even when every light was on, things felt very dark at night...so if you're traveling with two people...you might want to bring a make up mirror.
there are also only two elevators that serve not only the hotel guests, but also are used by staff members cleaning, bringing luggage to the rooms, and perform basic maintenance. to be clear, every employee we encountered was very kind about "waiting for the next elevator", but there was never a time...day or night...when we jumped right on to the elevator...there was always a wait.
our room was well cleaned, but the second night we were there, we returned after 11 pm to find that the maid had opened our windows, and did not close them again upon departing! the room was freezing!
and although the staff was friendly, there was one grumpy employee who i encountered on several occasions who seemed bothered when i asked for bottled water, or any other simple request. then, on our last evening, i politely asked if i could have two bottles of water on the way up to the room. she did not respond. thinking she hadn't hear me, i very politely asked again. she rudely said, "i heard you, we're out." wow.
i do not think i'll be visiting again.

least once a year and we stay in a lot of different hotels for different experiences and locations. we always stay at marriott’s and i recently became a vacation club owner. we have stayed at a lot of different properties in the united states and a few internationally and they have all been wonderful. the new york city pulse treated me like i was a piece of trash off the street. i have actually been in tears twice since coming here. the way the staff has lied to me and spoken to me, you would think i was a criminal. i am incredibly uncomfortable here and as i sit here on my last evening writing this review i hope i can spare anyone else from the terrible experience here. there are thousands of hotels in new york city and if you’re a marriott girl like me… you have your choice of different marriotts … please stay away from this one. they really need to train their staff on how to properly speak to paying customers. my last interaction was with a girl named bethany, who would not let me speak, kept speaking over me, told me that the hotel was at full capacity, and she could not accommodate any sort of late check out, while i was still speaking she hung up on me. i then had to call back and asked to speak to her colleague who was magically able to extend my check out for an hour or two. funny enough, i had to tell her that they weren’t at full capacity because i went on my marriott bonvoy account and was able to reserve three different rooms. this is just one example… i will admit there was some of the staff that was very nice here and all of the cleaning people were very, very sweet but the front desk people here desperately needs some training on how to talk to people. i probably stay in at least 10 different hotels a year and i have never been spoken to like this, and i have certainly never ended up in tears… you need to get your act together nyc pulse. you are truly making me regret my decision on becoming a marriot vacation club owner. for reference, i am also platinum elite marriott bonvoy. my son is 8 years old and he was even shocked at this interaction because even at eight years old, he is smart enough to know that is not how you treat people.

i am now editing this because i am reading some of the other one star reviews and i cannot believe how many complaints there are about the rude front desk staff. i also had a bad interaction with carter. very rude and a lot of huffing and puffing for even asking him a simple question. i thought i was just in a really bad room and had drunk people next-door to me, but i am now finding out that the walls are just really paper thin… there were very late night guest next to me, but the doors were so close together that it woke me up because i thought someone was breaking into my room and it was incredibly scary but now i’m understanding that they give earplugs because maybe everybody else has this experience also. wow, i really cannot believe how bad this hotel is… please please please do your research and book somewhere else because there are just so many excellent choices in new york city… i could rattle off 10 other hotels i’ve stayed at that have been absolutely amazing and they are all marriot brand.
